title: Contributing to sasquatch
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to sasquatch
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to sasquatch
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("ryanzomorrodi/sasr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to sasquatch
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to sasquatch
text: Please note sasquatch project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Setting Up
text: SAS ODA free SAS client professors, students, independent learners. Create account https://welcome.oda.sas.com/. set account, log note ODA server (picture United States 2) username (email profile dropdown). need later.

title: Setting Up
text: already Python already installed, install Python Python Software Foundation website.

title: Setting Up
text: already Java installed, install Java. Note path install java . Java installed, remember installed , … windows, usually installed C:\Program Files\Java\jdk{version number}, can double check opening terminal typing : mac linux, usually installed /usr/bin/java, can double check opening terminal typing : Note Java path later.

title: Setting Up
text: Note going install SASPy package global python install. ’s often better practice create virtual environment, conda environment, use one many ways isolate package installs. isn’t necessarily worry plan use SAS R together. windows, open command prompt type : linux max, open terminal type : install required packages SASPy print path installed. Navigate path find SASPy folder. SASPy package stored. Create new file within SASPy package called sascfg_personal.py. Inside file paste following: Remember back java installed computer replace {java path} path java install. Note: path contains \ replace / \\. Next, remember SAS ODA server account resides . Remove # line SAS ODA server. example: ’re almost done! One last thing. Windows, create file named _authinfo C:\Users\{username}\. Mac Linux, create file named .authinfo /home/{username}/ .k.. ~. Within file write following: Substitute {SAS ODA username} username noted earlier, {SAS ODA password} ODA password. ’re done setting SASPy!
code: py -m pip install wheel py -m pip install SASPy py -m pip install pandas py -m site --user-site python3 -m pip install wheel python3 -m pip install SASPy python3 -m pip install pandas python3 -m site --user-site SAS_config_names = ['oda']  oda = {     'java' : '{java path}',     #US Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws03-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws04-usw2.oda.sas.com'],     #US Home Region 2     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-usw2-2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-usw2-2.oda.sas.com'],     #European Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-euw1.oda.sas.com','odaws02-euw1.oda.sas.com'],     #Asia Pacific Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-apse1.oda.sas.com','odaws02-apse1.oda.sas.com'],     #Asia Pacific Home Region 2     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-apse1-2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-apse1-2.oda.sas.com'],     'iomport' : 8591,     'encoding' : 'utf-8',     'authkey' : 'oda' } SAS_config_names = ['oda']  oda = {     'java' : '/usr/bin/java',     #US Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws03-usw2.oda.sas.com','odaws04-usw2.oda.sas.com'],     #US Home Region 2     'iomhost' : ['odaws01-usw2-2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-usw2-2.oda.sas.com'],     #European Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-euw1.oda.sas.com','odaws02-euw1.oda.sas.com'],     #Asia Pacific Home Region 1     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-apse1.oda.sas.com','odaws02-apse1.oda.sas.com'],     #Asia Pacific Home Region 2     #'iomhost' : ['odaws01-apse1-2.oda.sas.com','odaws02-apse1-2.oda.sas.com'],     'iomport' : 8591,     'encoding' : 'utf-8',     'authkey' : 'oda' } oda user {your SAS ODA username} password {your SAS ODA password}

title: Setting Up
text: Now everything set , can start using sasquatch. Open favorite R IDE install sasquatch Use sas_use_quarto() create sasquatch quarto template download syntax definitions xml SAS within current directory. Regardless IDE, every sasquatch quarto starts : may also notice quarto yaml options applied within sasquatch quarto template. following portion yaml options, specifies quarto render html sas xml file downloaded used syntax highlighting. Note: time rendering html supported. next section xml specifies JavaScript library called iframe-resizer. allows SAS output render full extent within quarto output. Lastly, specify rendering engine knitr.
code: pak::pkg_install("ryanzomorrodi/sasquatch") library(sasquatch) sas_use_quarto() library(sasquatch) sas_connect() format:   html:     syntax-definitions:      - sas.xml include-in-header:   text: <script src = 'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@iframe-resizer/parent@5.3.2'></script> engine: knitr

title: Setting Up
text: Within RStudio, able run SAS chunks chunk. However, want able view SAS output within Viewer instead beneath chunk, can utilize sas_run_selected() addin. add keyboard shortcut addin, open Tools -> Modify Keyboard Shortcuts search “Run selected SAS”, type box Shortcut set keyboard shortcut liking click Apply.

title: Setting Up
text: Within Positron, able run SAS chunks R Python chunks. However, just RStudio, can create keyboard shortcut allow view SAS output within Plots pane. Open command palette ctrl+shift+p command+shift+p search “Preferences: Open Keyboard Shortcuts (JSON)”. Add following shortcuts. Edit key argument set preferred shortcut.

title: Use SAS, R, and quarto Together
text: Use SAS, R, Quarto together sasquatch allows combine power R, SAS, quarto together create reproducible multilingual reports. sasquatch can run SAS code blocks interactively, send data back forth SAS R, render SAS HTML output within quarto documents. sasquatch relies SASPy Python package. Don’t SASPy already installed, Don’t SAS License Check vignette("setting_up") guidance get started free SAS Demand Academics license (don’t need academic!).

title: A SAS HTML5 engine for knitr — sas_engine
text: sasquatch's engine implements may options R engine knitr, . eval (Default: TRUE): Evaluate code chunk (false, just echos code output) echo (Default: TRUE): Include source code output output (Default: TRUE): Include results executing code output (TRUE FALSE). include (Default: TRUE): Include output (code results). capture (Default: ""): "", tabpanel output log included. "lst", output included. "log" log included.
